remarks: The quotient of two polynomials in a field ` S ` is also in the field. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 26-Jul-2014.)
statement:
plydiv.pl $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ( x + y ) e. S ) $.
plydiv.tm $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ y e. S ) ) -> ( x x. y ) e. S ) $.
plydiv.rc $e |- ( ( ph /\ ( x e. S /\ x =/= 0 ) ) -> ( 1 / x ) e. S ) $.
plydiv.m1 $e |- ( ph -> -u 1 e. S ) $.
plydiv.f $e |- ( ph -> F e. ( Poly ` S ) ) $.
plydiv.g $e |- ( ph -> G e. ( Poly ` S ) ) $.
plydiv.z $e |- ( ph -> G =/= 0p ) $.
quotcl $p |- ( ph -> ( F quot G ) e. ( Poly ` S ) ) $.
$d F x y $.
$d G x y $.
$d S x y $.
$d ph x y $.
